image.altText: A woman with blond hair and pink glasses looks at a woman

props.synopsis: When Rebecca's doctor asked her about her relationship, identifying it as domestic abuse, it was the "circuit breaker" she needed to get out. New training is helping more patients get the same support.

title.children: Rebecca credits her GP with saving her life. Here's what she wants other doctors to know

image.altText: A skier goes past a snow gun

props.synopsis: Many of the world's ski field operators now rely on snow machines to guarantee business, but others say the practice uses too much water and risks environmental harm.

title.children: Snow guns prove Ben Lomond ski field 'very viable' as park considers future

image.altText: a view of St Patrick's Catholic cathedral in East Melbourne

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation can reveal the Catholic Church tried to revive a highly controversial legal loophole that stopped it from being sued by victims of sexual abuse for millions of dollars in damages, after it was scrapped in 2018.

title.children: Tasmanian victim-survivor fears Catholic Church abuse case fallen off national law reform agenda

image.altText: Dane takes a selfie with son Ari

props.synopsis: From learning patience and gratitude, to pushing past their comfort zone, we hear from six dads about the "transformative" experience of having children.

title.children: Men reflect on how fatherhood has changed them

image.altText: A red and black graphic of a crowd in silhouette under a white supremacist flag and the Australian flag.

props.synopsis: As the National Socialist Network follows the script of a far-right playbook in an attempt to position itself as a political movement, there are moves to have it proscribed as a terrorist group.

title.children: How overseas terrorist groups are shaping Australia's far-right

image.altText: A small hand holding a handful of blueberries

props.synopsis: A scientist investigating why pesticides were appearing in marine life discovers a banned chemical on NSW berries. The underwhelming response from the government has exposed regulatory blind spots in the system meant to protect consumers.

title.children: Scientist discovers banned chemical in berries sold at NSW supermarkets

image.altText: GettyImages-2233113636

props.synopsis: Dockers coach Justin Longmuir says the AFL should issue fines of up to $10,000 to players for staging.

title.children: Coach calls for huge fines to stamp out AFL players staging for free kicks

image.altText: Hamiso Tabuai-Fidow scores for the Dolphins.

props.synopsis: As the Dolphins run up a score on the first-placed Raiders, Hamiso Tabuai-Fidow needs four tries to equal league-leading Mark Nawaqanitawase in the race for the Ken Irvine Medal. Follow live.

title.children: Hamiso double enlivens race for top try-scorer as Dolphins hammer Raiders

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: It's a gift for the Raiders!

image.altText: Andrew Moore, Billy Moore and Karina Brown in the ABC Sport commentary box before a Women's State of Origin game.

props.synopsis: ABC Sport commentator Andrew Moore says he does not know when he will be back on the radio, but is "oddly excited" about the recovery process after his heart attack last month.

title.children: At age of 56, ABC commentator Andrew Moore starts afresh after 'miracle survival'

image.altText: Albanese and Morrison pull the same pose, listening with each of their fingers entwined

props.synopsis: When he lashed Scott Morrison over the multiple ministries affair, Anthony Albanese said his predecessor "operated in darkness". But this week, a PM with a patchy transparency record of his own announced a plan to dim the lights.

title.children: Albanese scoffed at Morrison's secrecy. Then he copied it

image.altText: A larger portrait of a teenage boy sits before a crowd of Catholic clergy in white robes and pink skull caps.

props.synopsis: Carlo Acutis, an Italian teenager who died in 2006, will today become the first saint of the internet age.

title.children: First millennial saint to be canonised by Pope Leo at the Vatican

image.altText: A house auction in Norwood

props.synopsis: The "inflation nutters" in New Zealand adopted inflation targeting first, and Australia pinched their idea. But the policy has unresolved issues, a former RBA deputy governor says.

title.children: The RBA has never known what to do about property prices, former deputy governor says

image.altText: Aryna Sabalenka kisses the US Open trophy

props.synopsis: World number one Aryna Sabalenka successfully defends her US Open title, with a straight-sets win in the final against American Amanda Anisimova at Flushing Meadows.

title.children: Sabalenka apologises for 'really terrible' behaviour after claiming US Open win

image.altText: A piece of machinery moves along the ocean floor. A cloud rises behind it. In front of it are small rocks.

props.synopsis: A push to extract minerals from the depths of the Pacific Ocean is gaining momentum. Here is how it works and why it has become a global flashpoint.

title.children: Kilometres below the waves, a global fight is brewing

image.altText: A woman smiles for a photo while holding a large bouquet of orange flowers and baby's breath

props.synopsis: Sana Yousaf's murder shocked Pakistan. She was one of more than 700 women allegedly murdered in the nation this year alone.

title.children: TikToker's murder exposes dark culture in Pakistan's online spaces

image.altText: Nicho Hynes of the Sharks celebrates following his team's win in the NRL semifinal

props.synopsis: Sharks star Nicho Hynes is offered a one-game suspension for a hip-drop tackle on Marcelo Montoya.

title.children: Hynes cops one-week ban in major blow to Sharks ahead of finals

image.altText: Man wearing glasses being carried by people in high-vis jackets

props.synopsis: London police arrest about 425 Palestine Action supporters, following a previous arrest of nearly 500 supporters last month.

title.children: UK police arrest banned Palestine Action group supporters in London

image.altText: A graphic of a light bulb and a timeline so symbolise power prices or electricity prices.

props.synopsis: Consumer advocates are calling for an overhaul of the market mechanism that allows wholesale power prices in Australia’s biggest grid to soar to the highest levels in the world.

title.children: Calls for electricity overhaul amid power price spikes, lack of investment

image.altText: A woman holds photos of kids looking sad at the camera.

props.synopsis: Susan Dahal is finally able to apply to reunite with her children, but the Refugee Council of Australia says the process is "cruel" and not designed for refugees.

title.children: Mother endures 'cruel' wait to reunite with children after 13 years

image.altText: A man leans on a red park bench.

props.synopsis: Prostate cancer is one of Australia's most commonly diagnosed cancers. One Aussie dad wants men to take it seriously and get checked.

title.children: 'Be a proud father, go and get a test': Cancer survivor's message to dads

image.altText: Two men shake hands in front of Chinese and Russian flags

props.synopsis: Flanked by the leaders of some of the world's most sanctioned nations, Chinese President Xi Jinping led what some analysts have dubbed an "axis of upheaval" this week.

title.children: Trump's global lesson in how to lose friends and alienate people

image.altText: The battered back of a watch bearing a name and other details

props.synopsis: The final resting place of more than 30,000 Australian soldiers from World War I and II is unknown. With DNA breakthroughs, more families are trying to find their ancestors' graves.

title.children: War detectives try to solve mystery of Australia's missing soldiers

image.altText: A man leans on a concrete wall with a refugee camp in the background.

props.synopsis: Tim Buxton is returning to northern Iraq where he lived and worked during some of the region's most tumultuous times in recent history.

title.children: Former humanitarian aid worker runs across Iraq for refugees

image.altText: a young man with a moustache sits at a table with his chin in his hand

props.synopsis: As more men are being diagnosed with eating disorders, experts say stereotypes are still making recovery harder.

title.children: More men are getting eating disorders — but stereotypes make recovery harder

image.altText: A video still of Tom Gleeson behind a podium. The ABC lissajous in the top left corner and the Hard Quiz logo in the top right

props.synopsis: I'll believe it when I see it … Let's play, HARD!

title.children: I know you think you know the answers to this quiz

image.altText: A large auditorium with rows of chairs facing three PowerPoint screens

props.synopsis: Türkiye rejects Australia's bid to host the COP31 climate summit in Adelaide.

title.children: Australia and Türkiye fight to host COP31 climate summit

image.altText: d

props.synopsis: The recent protests across Indonesia, and across the globe, wasn't just sparked by public outrage over the generous perks awarded to MPs — but from deeper-rooted problems with the country's democratic system.

title.children: 'Apologies' not enough as anger grows toward Indonesia's political elites

image.altText: Bangor building

props.synopsis: Experts say cost-of-living pressures are impacting child care, with many grandparents being relied on to help ease the burden on struggling parents.

title.children: Sydney childcare centre mix-up puts role of grandparents in spotlight

image.altText: A portrait of Renee Gracie preparing to race in the 2023 GT World Challenge.

props.synopsis: Renee Gracie had her dream career in motorsport, but says sexism and the culture forced her out. OnlyFans kept her afloat in some dark days, and now she's back on the circuit with their support.

title.children: OnlyFans restored Renee Gracie’s self esteem and her motorsport career

image.altText: A very ramshackle house with iron boards acting as a fence, black tee hangs over it. Seen through a wire mesh.

props.synopsis: Sick of waiting decades for repairs and new homes, an Indigenous community in WA pools funds to buy two houses, made in China from shipping containers, to house its most vulnerable residents.

title.children: After waiting 50 years, remote community resorts to Chinese prefab homes

image.altText: Boxes of cigarettes surrounded by Australian cash.

props.synopsis: The ABC, via interviews, reviews of court records and attending dozens of illegal stores, can today reveal new details and allegations about the trade.

title.children: The figures behind Australia's illicit tobacco trade

image.altText: A bright yellow frog with brown markings on its face sitting on a wet rock.

props.synopsis: For the first time, researchers have been able to successfully breed and release into the wild an endangered species of mountain frog.

title.children: These frogs are tiny, but their very existence is a huge sign of hope
